name: 楊士萱
objective: This course will address both theory and practice of video signal processing, mainly focused on the video coding. The MPEG standards will be covered in depth.
schedule:
1.Introduction
2.Entropy coding
3.Quantization and predictive coding
4.Transform coding and JPEG
5.Motion estimation and motion compensation
6.MPEG-1/2 video coding standards
7.MPEG-4 part-2 and part-10 (H.264), HEVC
8.MPEG-4 Parts 12_14_15, MPEG-7, MPEG-21, and beyond
9.Special topics in video coding (error resilience and error concealment, scalable video coding, 3D video, distributed video coding, watermarking)
10.Wavelet coding and JPEG 2000
scorePolicy:

materials:
About Term Project:
1.The Term Project is required only for graduate students. It counts 20% of the final grade for graduate students.
2.Suggested topics: 3D video (multi-view video coding, depth estimation, view synthesis), H.264 scalable video coding, HEVC (high-efficiency video coding), H.264/MPEG-2 transcoding, H.264 error resilience and error concealment, wavelet-based image or video processing, and other emerging VSP techniques.
3.You need to implement a VSP algorithm by yourself in C, C++, Java, or MATLAB. Programs readily available can only be used as references or a part of your code. You must clearly identify your efforts and contribution.
Grading:
1.Proposal, 10%
2.Functionality and contribution, 50%
3.Oral presentation, 20%
4.Written report with simulation results and codes, 20%
